descr.p: fpTemplate implements a class which can replace variables in a template text. The template variables are enclosed in delimiters. When a variable is encountered, it can be replaced by a string value. An event is called to get the value for a template variable. It does not contain loops or conditionals, but parametrized templates are possible.
The unit also contains and its descendant . Which is a basic implementation that uses the template parser to substitute variables in a text.

element.name: SysUtils
element.short: Contains system utilities.

element.name: Classes
element.short: Contains base classes.

element.name: DefaultParseDepth
element.short: Default maximum recursion depth for parsing.
element.descr: DefaultParseDepth is the default value for the maximum recursion depth when parsing templates.

element.name: MaxDelimLength
element.short: Maximum length for a delimiter string.
element.descr: MaxDelimLength is the maximum length (in characters) for a delimiter string.

element.name: TParseDelimiter
element.short: Type for a delimiter string.
element.descr: TParseDelimiter is the type used for the delimiter strings. Its maximum length is .

element.name: DefaultStartDelimiter
element.short: Default start delimiter for a template variable.
element.descr: DefaultStartDelimiter is the default character which indicates the start of a template variable. By default this is the { character.

element.name: DefaultEndDelimiter
element.short: Default end delimiter for a template variable.
element.descr: DefaultEndDelimiter is the default character which indicates the end of a template variable. By default this is the } character.

element.name: DefaultParamStartDelimiter
element.short: Default start delimiter for a template variable parameter.
element.descr: DefaultParamStartDelimiter is the default string which indicates the start of a template variable's parameter. By default this is the [- string.

element.name: DefaultParamEndDelimiter
element.short: Default end delimiter for a template variable parameter.
element.descr: DefaultParamEndDelimiter is the default string which indicates the end of a template variable's parameter. By default this is the -] string.

element.name: DefaultParamValueSeparator
element.short: Default separator for a template variable parameter and its value.
element.descr: DefaultParamValueSeparator is the default character which separates a template variable's parameter and its value. By default this is the = character.

element.name: TGetParamEvent
element.short: Event to get a value for a template variable.
element.descr: TGetParamEvent is the type of the event that is called when the template parser needs the value for a certain template variable.

element.name: TGetParamEvent.Sender
element.short: Object that triggered the event.

element.name: TGetParamEvent.ParamName
element.short: Name of the parameter to get a value for.

element.name: TGetParamEvent.AValue
element.short: Value for the parameter.

element.name: TReplaceTagEvent
element.short: Event to replace a tag.
element.descr: TReplaceTagEvent is the type of the event that is called when the template parser needs to replace a tag.

element.name: TReplaceTagEvent.Sender
element.short: Object that triggered the event.

element.name: TReplaceTagEvent.TagString
element.short: Tag to be replaced.

element.name: TReplaceTagEvent.TagParams
element.short: Parameters for the tag.

element.name: TReplaceTagEvent.ReplaceText
element.short: The replacement text.

element.name: TTemplateParser
element.short: A class to parse templates.

descr.p: TTemplateParser is a class that can parse a text and substitute template variables with their values.

The template variables are enclosed in delimiters, by default { and }. Whenever a variable is found, its value is looked up in the property. If it is not found there, the event is called to obtain a value for the variable.
The delimiters can be set using the various delimiter properties.

errors.p: If the text is deeply nested, an exception may be raised.

element.name: TTemplateParser.Create
element.short: Create a new instance of the template parser.
element.descr: Create instantiates a new TTemplateParser object. It initializes the delimiters to their default values and sets the maximum parse depth.

element.name: TTemplateParser.Destroy
element.short: Frees the template parser instance.
element.descr: Destroy cleans up the TTemplateParser instance and frees any memory allocated by it. In particular, it will free the list of values.

element.name: TTemplateParser.Clear
element.short: Clear the list of values.
element.descr: Clear removes all values from the list of values.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ReplaceTag
element.short: Replace a tag with a value.

descr.p: ReplaceTag will replace the tag with name Key and parameters TagParams with the value in ReplaceWith.
The function returns True if the tag was replaced, False otherwise. A replacement will happen if the event is assigned.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ReplaceTag.Result
element.short: True if the tag was replaced.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ReplaceTag.Key
element.short: Name of the tag to replace.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ReplaceTag.TagParams
element.short: Parameters for the tag.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ReplaceTag.ReplaceWith
element.short: The replacement value for the tag.

element.name: TTemplateParser.GetParam
element.short: Get a value for a parameter.

descr.p: GetParam will get the value for the parameter with name Key and return it in AValue.
First, the list is consulted. If the parameter is not found there, the event is called. If the parameter is found, the function returns True, otherwise it returns False.

element.name: TTemplateParser.GetParam.Result
element.short: True if a value was found for the parameter.

element.name: TTemplateParser.GetParam.Key
element.short: Name of the parameter to get a value for.

element.name: TTemplateParser.GetParam.AValue
element.short: The value for the parameter.

element.name: TTemplateParser.GetTagParams
element.short: Extract tag parameters from a tag name.
element.descr: GetTagParams will extract any tag parameters from the tag name TagName and return them in the TagParams stringlist. The tag name itself is also adapted.

element.name: TTemplateParser.GetTagParams.TagName
element.short: The name of the tag.

element.name: TTemplateParser.GetTagParams.TagParams
element.short: The list of tag parameters.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParseString
element.short: Parse a string and substitute variables.
element.descr: ParseString will parse the string Src and substitute all template variables with their values. The resulting string is returned.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParseString.Result
element.short: The parsed string.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParseString.Src
element.short: The string to parse.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParseStream
element.short: Parse a stream and substitute variables.
element.descr: ParseStream will read the content of stream Src, substitute all template variables with their values and write the result to stream Dest. The function returns the number of bytes written to the destination stream.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParseStream.Result
element.short: Number of bytes written to the destination stream.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParseStream.Src
element.short: The stream to parse.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParseStream.Dest
element.short: The stream to write the parsed content to.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParseStrings
element.short: Parse a stringlist and substitute variables.
element.descr: ParseStrings will read the strings from the stringlist Src, substitute all template variables with their values and add the resulting strings to the stringlist Dest.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParseStrings.Src
element.short: The stringlist to parse.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParseStrings.Dest
element.short: The stringlist to add the parsed strings to.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParseFiles
element.short: Parse a file and substitute variables.
element.descr: ParseFiles will read the content of file Src, substitute all template variables with their values and write the result to file Dest.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParseFiles.Src
element.short: The file to parse.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParseFiles.Dest
element.short: The file to write the parsed content to.

element.name: TTemplateParser.OnGetParam
element.short: Event to get a value for a template variable.
element.descr: OnGetParam is the event that is called when the template parser needs the value for a certain template variable. This event is only used when simple template tags are allowed.

element.name: TTemplateParser.OnReplaceTag
element.short: Event to replace a tag.
element.descr: OnReplaceTag is the event that is called when the template parser needs to replace a tag. This event is used when template tags with parameters are allowed.

element.name: TTemplateParser.StartDelimiter
element.short: Start delimiter for a template variable.
element.descr: StartDelimiter is the character which indicates the start of a template variable. By default this is the { character.

element.name: TTemplateParser.EndDelimiter
element.short: End delimiter for a template variable.
element.descr: EndDelimiter is the character which indicates the end of a template variable. By default this is the } character.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParamStartDelimiter
element.short: Start delimiter for a template variable parameter.
element.descr: ParamStartDelimiter is the string which indicates the start of a template variable's parameter. By default this is the [- string.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParamEndDelimiter
element.short: End delimiter for a template variable parameter.
element.descr: ParamEndDelimiter is the string which indicates the end of a template variable's parameter. By default this is the -] string.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ParamValueSeparator
element.short: Separator for a template variable parameter and its value.
element.descr: ParamValueSeparator is the character which separates a template variable's parameter and its value. By default this is the = character.

element.name: TTemplateParser.Values
element.short: List of values for template variables.
element.descr: Values is a stringlist that contains key-value pairs. The key is the name of the template variable, and the value is the string to replace the variable with. This property is only used when simple template tags are allowed.

element.name: TTemplateParser.Values.Key
element.short: Name of the template variable.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ValuesByIndex
element.short: Access to values by index.
element.descr: ValuesByIndex provides access to the values in the list by index. This property is only used when simple template tags are allowed.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ValuesByIndex.index
element.short: Index of the value to retrieve.

element.name: TTemplateParser.NamesByIndex
element.short: Access to variable names by index.
element.descr: NamesByIndex provides access to the names of the variables in the list by index. This property is only used when simple template tags are allowed.

element.name: TTemplateParser.NamesByIndex.index
element.short: Index of the name to retrieve.

element.name: TTemplateParser.ValueCount
element.short: Number of values in the list.
element.descr: ValueCount is the number of values in the list. This property is only used when simple template tags are allowed.

element.name: TTemplateParser.Recursive
element.short: Enable recursive parsing.
element.descr: If Recursive is set to True, then the substituted values are parsed again for template variables. This property is only used when simple template tags are allowed.

element.name: TTemplateParser.AllowTagParams
element.short: Allow tags with parameters.
element.descr: If AllowTagParams is set to True, then tags with parameters are allowed. If False, then only simple tags are allowed.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate
element.short: Base class for templates.

descr.p: TFPCustomTemplate is a base class for template processing. It can load a template from a file or from a string and then uses a instance to parse the template.
Do not use this class directly, use instead.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.HasContent
element.short: Check if the template has content.
element.descr: HasContent returns True if the template has content, i.e. either the or the property is set.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.HasContent.Result
element.short: True if the template has content.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.GetContent
element.short: Get the parsed template content.
element.descr: GetContent will parse the template and return the result. If the property is set, the content of the file is parsed. Otherwise the property is parsed.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.GetContent.Result
element.short: The parsed template content.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.Assign
element.short: Assign one template to another.
element.descr: Assign will copy the properties of the Source template to the current one.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.Assign.Source
element.short: The source template.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.StartDelimiter
element.short: Start delimiter for a template variable.
element.descr: StartDelimiter is the character which indicates the start of a template variable. By default this is the { character.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.EndDelimiter
element.short: End delimiter for a template variable.
element.descr: EndDelimiter is the character which indicates the end of a template variable. By default this is the } character.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.ParamStartDelimiter
element.short: Start delimiter for a template variable parameter.
element.descr: ParamStartDelimiter is the string which indicates the start of a template variable's parameter. By default this is the [- string.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.ParamEndDelimiter
element.short: End delimiter for a template variable parameter.
element.descr: ParamEndDelimiter is the string which indicates the end of a template variable's parameter. By default this is the -] string.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.ParamValueSeparator
element.short: Separator for a template variable parameter and its value.
element.descr: ParamValueSeparator is the character which separates a template variable's parameter and its value. By default this is the = character.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.FileName
element.short: Name of the file with the template.
element.descr: FileName is the name of the file that contains the template text.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.Template
element.short: The template text.
element.descr: Template contains the template text.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.OnGetParam
element.short: Event to get a value for a template variable.
element.descr: OnGetParam is the event that is called when the template parser needs the value for a certain template variable. This event is only used when simple template tags are allowed.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.OnReplaceTag
element.short: Event to replace a tag.
element.descr: OnReplaceTag is the event that is called when the template parser needs to replace a tag. This event is used when template tags with parameters are allowed.

element.name: TFPCustomTemplate.AllowTagParams
element.short: Allow tags with parameters.
element.descr: If AllowTagParams is set to True, then tags with parameters are allowed. If False, then only simple tags are allowed.

element.name: TFPTemplate
element.short: Template component.

descr.p: TFPTemplate is a component that can be used to parse templates. It is a descendant of and publishes the properties of its ancestor.
It can be dropped on a form and its properties can be set in the object inspector.

element.name: TFPTemplate.FileName
element.short: Name of the file with the template.
element.descr: See .

element.name: TFPTemplate.Template
element.short: The template text.
element.descr: See .

element.name: TFPTemplate.AllowTagParams
element.short: Allow tags with parameters.
element.descr: See .

element.name: TFPTemplate.OnReplaceTag
element.short: Event to replace a tag.
element.descr: See .

element.name: TFPTemplate.StartDelimiter
element.short: Start delimiter for a template variable.
element.descr: See .

element.name: TFPTemplate.EndDelimiter
element.short: End delimiter for a template variable.
element.descr: See .

element.name: TFPTemplate.ParamStartDelimiter
element.short: Start delimiter for a template variable parameter.
element.descr: See .

element.name: TFPTemplate.ParamEndDelimiter
element.short: End delimiter for a template variable parameter.
element.descr: See .

element.name: TFPTemplate.ParamValueSeparator
element.short: Separator for a template variable parameter and its value.
element.descr: See .

element.name: TFPTemplate.OnGetParam
element.short: Event to get a value for a template variable.
element.descr: See .

element.name: ETemplateParser
element.short: Exception for template parser errors.
element.descr: ETemplateParser is the exception class for errors that occur during template parsing.

element.name: MaxParseDepth
element.short: Maximum recursion depth for parsing.
element.descr: MaxParseDepth is the maximum recursion depth when parsing templates. If this depth is exceeded, an exception is raised.
